label: Schedule & Milestones
quote: ...it is vitally important that the contractor be able to perform all requirements in this SOW within one month of contract award.
short_label: Complete SOW requirements within one month of award

label: Submission
quote: The contractor will submit a draft copy of a detailed Transition-In Plan at the time of the proposal. The Transition-In Plan will include the following: A detailed transition methodology in logical sequence to ensure a smooth transition of all tasks of the contract without interruption or degradation of service levels; A timeline for completion; and Associated risk, issues, and risk mitigation strategies.
short_label: Submit draft Transition-In Plan with proposal

label: Submission
quote: The final Transition-In Plan will be submitted to the COR no later than 5 calendar days after contract award date.
short_label: Submit final Transition-In Plan within 5 days of award

label: Supply Chain & Property Management
quote: At the expiration of this contract, the contractor will ensure that all records, documents, and files are shipped under the terms of the contract by the U. S. Postal Service Priority Mail with receipted delivery (i.e., returned receipt, ...
short_label: Ship all records by USPS Priority Mail at contract end

label: Privacy & Data Protection
quote: All documents should be secured in accordance with the DHS Handbook for Safeguarding Sensitive Personally Identifiable Information (PII).
short_label: Secure delivery of documents per DHS PII Handbook

label: Compliance & Regulatory
quote: All contractor personnel performing work under the terms of this contract will complete and sign DHS Form 1100-6, Non-Disclosure Agreement. The contractor will provide the completed form to the COR before a contract employee has access to any information, materials, or documents pertaining to the Contract.
short_label: Complete and submit NDA before access

label: Customer Service & Communications
quote: The contractor will provide HRM with expert retirement counseling services to employees as needed and requested, including providing advice and assistance on questions regarding service computation dates and eligibility of certain periods of Federal and/or military service where retirement coverage is or might be questionable; providing retirement estimates (Civil Service Retirement System (CSRS) to include CSRS Offset and Federal Employees’ Retirement System (FERS); and explaining Thrift Savings Plan (TSP) options; Federal employees’ Health Benefits (FEHB) coverage, Federal Employees Group Life Insurance (FEGLI) coverage, Social Security (SS) coverage, and deposits and re-deposits to the retirement fund as these issues relate to the retirement program.
short_label: Provide expert retirement counseling to employees

label: Customer Service & Communications
quote: The contractor will provide HRM with expert assistance to employees in the preparation and submission of retirement applications and all related benefits forms and requirements. The contractor will ensure that the application package is complete and accurate before it is submitted by RABAS for final preparation and submission to the Office of Personnel Management (OPM). The contractor will verify that assigned completed cases have been uploaded to USDA’s ServiceNow (SNOW) database and that the personnel separation action has applied to the USDA NFC database, and when necessary, determine when NFC has submitted the retirement application to OPM.
short_label: Assist with retirement application preparation and submission

label: Customer Service & Communications
quote: The contractor will provide HRM with counseling to Custom and Border Protection (CBP) management, employees, retirees, and family members on benefit program entitlements/options and on interpretations of the law, regulations, and policies to CBP and DHS employees. This involves meeting with employees, including employees covered by the Customs and Border Protection Officers, and law enforcement officers to explain the different aspects of both FERS and CSRS/CSRS Offset, and will also include any other pay initiative such as Customs Officers Pay Reform Act (COPRA); Border Patrol Agent Pay Reform Act; Law Enforcement Availability Pay or any other premium pay that impacts employee retirement.
short_label: Counsel CBP management, employees, retirees, and families on benefits

label: Management & Staffing
quote: The contractor shall provide a single point of contact that shall serve as the Project Manager for the life of the Contract.
short_label: Provide Project Manager as single point of contact

label: Personnel & Qualifications
quote: 4.5.1 Validation of service computation dates.
short_label: Validate service computation dates

label: Personnel & Qualifications
quote: 4.5.2 Verification of the retirement coverage code.
short_label: Verify retirement coverage code

label: Personnel & Qualifications
quote: 4.5.3 Verification of Federal service.
short_label: Verify Federal service

label: Personnel & Qualifications
quote: 4.5.4 The employee’s entitlements under the TSP.
short_label: Determine employee TSP entitlements

label: Personnel & Qualifications
quote: 4.5.5 The employee’s options under FEHB.
short_label: Determine employee FEHB options

label: Personnel & Qualifications
quote: 4.5.6 The employee’s options under FEGLI.
short_label: Determine employee FEGLI options

label: Personnel & Qualifications
quote: 4.5.7 The employee’s options regarding Social Security eligibility, Medicare, etc.
short_label: Determine Social Security/Medicare eligibility options

label: Customer Service & Communications
quote: 4.5.8 Assist with counseling employees concerning making service credit payments and post-1956 military service deposits.
short_label: Counsel employees on service credit payments and military deposits

label: Personnel & Qualifications
quote: 4.5.9 Estimated retirement computations.
short_label: Estimate retirement computations

label: Customer Service & Communications
quote: 4.5.10 Obtain additional information from potential retirees as needed.
short_label: Obtain additional information from potential retirees

label: Customer Service & Communications
quote: 4.5.11 Complete Retirement Applications.
short_label: Complete retirement applications

label: Customer Service & Communications
quote: 4.5.12 Assist with follow-up communication with retiree to ensure receipt of leave/retirement payments.
short_label: Follow up with retirees to ensure receipt of payments

label: Customer Service & Communications
quote: 4.5.13 Assist with providing employees and survivors of deceased employees’ estimates of expected benefits.
short_label: Provide benefit estimates to employees and survivors

label: Operations & Sustainment
quote: 4.5.14 Participate in Special projects.
short_label: Participate in special projects

label: Training & Workforce Development
quote: 4.5.15 Support and participate in outreach initiatives and retirement seminars, etc.
short_label: Support and participate in outreach and retirement seminars
